page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY_OPIE PAINTS
page.content: John Opie A famous painter born near Perranporth. John Opie was born in 1761 at Harmony Cott near Mithian.John's ambition was to be an artist but his father thought there was no money in painting so he taught John carpentry.When he was 15 years old his talent as an artist was recognised by Dr John Wolcot, a rich doctor and Opie went to live with him in Truro.Dr Wolcot was his tutor and he paid for Opie to have lessons.His first painting was of a local farmhouse which he sold for 5 shillings.When he was 18 he went to Exeter and displayed his work at the Society of Artists.Then he went to London and painted portraits of rich people.Soon fame came.
